intro: Galium idubedae f. humile, commonly known as the low-growing bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is a low, mat-forming perennial that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors and stream banks. The plant features slender stems covered in fine hairs and small, opposite leaves with a slightly serrated edge. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, clustered in dense inflorescences, and bloom in early spring. It plays a role in supporting local insect populations and is often found in temperate regions of Europe.
